DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim randomize , control study evaluate impact feasibility prolong physical activity intervention school-aged childhood cancer survivor self-report sedentary lifestyle . The study test hypothesis childhood cancer survivor participate physical activity intervention guide Social Cognitive Theory increase amount time spend daily moderate vigorous physical activity , improve exercise self-efficacy compare child randomize usual care . A secondary aim assess impact intervention cardiovascular risk factor include fitness body composition .
DOC.brief_title: Group Intervention Increase Physical Activity Childhood Cancer Survivors
DOC.criteria: 1 . Cancer survivor age 812 year . 2 . Off therapy least 3 month 5 year remission . 3 . Medical clearance participate physical activity survivor 's primary oncology provider ; 4 . Selfreport < 60 minute moderate vigorous physical activity ( MVPA ) per day . 5 . Must able ambulate . 6 . Signed informed consent/assent .
